intro: Ricinocarpus peduncularis, commonly known as the Indian nettle or velvetleaf, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish in color. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, including India, and thrives in moist, disturbed soils. It is often found in agricultural fields and along roadsides, where it can become a weed. The plant has a fibrous root system and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds.
